alert.note: Alert for Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 8:21PM EST until February 04 at 2:39PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Guernsey, Monroe and Noble. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette, Greene, Indiana, Washington and Westmoreland. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marion, Marshall, Monongalia, Ohio, Preston and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM EST, gauge reports indicated elevated or flooded streams and creeks across the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgantown, Wheeling, Greensburg, Fairmont, Washington, Cambridge, Uniontown, Jeannette, Moundsville, Latrobe, Connellsville, Martins Ferry, New Martinsville, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Barnesville, Waynesburg, Westover, Warwood and Bethlehem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
